articles.description: The new 4 Series could debut this June.
articles.content: Development for the various BMW 4 Series variants continues as the automaker takes two different versions to the Nürburgring. New videos show both cars at the famous track, and both are still rocking camouflage. However, we can see the large, controversial gr… [+1531 chars]

articles.author: Nicole Carpenter
articles.title: In Other Waters is about exploring an alien ocean through an AI interface - Polygon
articles.description: In Other Waters, from developer Jump Over The Age, is a unique game that takes place entirely on a map interface. It’s out now on Windows PC and Nintendo Switch.
articles.content:
I know so much about Gliese 677Cc, the planetary setting of In Other Waters. The alien ocean is a weird, wonderful ecosystem of strange stalks, spores, and creatures scattered among its depths. 
Ive noticed the odd behavior of the oceans flora and fauna. Ive… [+5874 chars]

articles.title: Moving Out Review - IGN
articles.description: Enjoyably tense and frequently hysterical, Moving Out is a must play for fans of same-screen multiplayer games. Reviewed by Tristan Ogilvie on Nintendo Switc...
articles.content: Enjoyably tense and frequently hysterical, Moving Out is a must play for fans of same-screen multiplayer games. Reviewed by Tristan Ogilvie on Nintendo Switch. Also available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One and PC.

articles.title: Malwarebytes releases new VPN service for Windows - BleepingComputer
articles.description: Malwarebytes is expanding into privacy with the release of a new Windows VPN service called Malwarebytes Privacy. Malwarebytes plans on offering Mac, iOS, Android, and ChromeOS versions in the future.
articles.content:

articles.title: Crucial Launches Its Fastest Ever M.2 SSD - PCMag
articles.description: The P5 is a PCIe 3.0 x4 M.2 SSD capable of reaching 3,400MB/s read speeds and 3,000MB/s writes.
articles.content:
We're fast approaching the end of the road for PCIe 3.0 as PCIe 4.0 adoption begins by storage and motherboard manufacturers, but Crucial is offering us one more, "extra fast" 3.0 drive called the P5.
The Crucial P5 SSD is a PCIe x4 NVMe M.2 drive using Micr… [+1679 chars]
